Reviews.Title: “Purr-fect Budget Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Heeter
Reviews.Content: We had the kitchenette on the 2nd level #202. Squeaky clean and the whitest freshest sheets ever! Air con, TV, free coffee, WIFI. Mexican flare, clean, simple, safe and basic. Includes the friendliest cat named Coco who does her daily rounds of inspection and visiting. Our room (as all rooms) overlook the pool and lovely well-kept garden area. A few blocks to town but close to some of the tastiest (cheapest) local food around. Thanks Diane for your assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good quality :)”
Reviews.Author: Anuunuu1
Reviews.Content: I want to thank Diane with all her help to make our holiday perfect. We stayed only 1 night, but we wanted to come back for our last days, unfortunately they were fully booked. Diane make all her best to help and find us the other hotel with the swimming pool. Nice quiet place with nice colours. KIITOS!

Reviews.Title: “cozy, quiet, friendly and affordable”
Reviews.Author: BeachBonita
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2.5 weeks this month, telecommuting but also having some fun in Playa with relatives. Manager Diane & her team run a spotless, tidy and pleasant 12-unit oasis in the middle of a working-class neighborhood. Rooms are plain but cute, and there is always somebody cleaning, retouching the brightly colored paint, making more coffee, or helping guests. And while there is nothing particularly scenic about the location, as has been mentioned it's within easy walking distance of many resources. You can get a beach towel from housekeeping and walk 5 short blocks to the ocean, or read in the hammock on your patio, sit and doze under the big circular palapa or by the pristine pool, talk to other guests (a mix of Canada, Europe and US), and play with Coco the cat (who will appear on your patio when you come home if you give her some leftover chicken). Some rooms have a small kitchenette and some have a fridge only. (The one apartment has a lot more than that.) A fan, air conditioning, and a cable TV round things out. Oh, and wireless, without which I would not have been able to do my work. One caveat about that - the more guests on their laptops, the less bandwith there is, and this gave me occasional trouble with my connection. Diane was looking into getting a better modem when I left. There's the best chicken joint in Playa (in a sort of 'cage' on 2nd and 20th that closes at 6 pm), the stores and banks within 2-3 blocks, Walmart, Megamart, etc. A nice casual breakfast place seemingly in somebody's 'back yard' - attached to the little grocery store across the street. Keep in mind that the streets in Playa jump by 2's from north to south, and from east to west jump in 5's. So 30th is NOT 5 blocks from 25th, but just one block. Playa is pretty walkable overall. Taxis are generally 25 to 30 pesos to most places in town. A rental car tip: go online to Avis and book a car for the "downtown Playa" location, which is actually at Constituyentes and the highway. The rate will be much cheaper than anything you can get walking in. (For instance, a subcompact for a day with tax was $23 USD the 3 times we rented. This did not include the collision insurance but our credit card issuer covers that.) Book a day ahead so there's time to transmit your reservation to that location. Although staying in this part of Playa is much quieter than anywhere else closer to 5th avenue, it's still a bit 'urban' feeling, so if you are looking for total beach-side relaxation and beauty, this is not it. But the rates are extremely fair for what you get, and their many repeat and long-term guests attest to the value of El Acuario. Diane has been the best manager they've had in years, from what I hear, so expect this place to be popular for many reasons among 'value-seeking' travelers. (Oh, yes, the beds are very firm, but better than too soft in my opinion!) And the coffee - it's Koba brand that Diane gets at Sam's Club. I bought a bag to take back to the U.S. I don't even drink coffee but this stuff was GOOD! From the mountains of Chiapas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay and Enjoy Playa del Carmen!”
Reviews.Author: Tess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our December holidays here and I'm so glad that I chose this place! The staff are so friendly (even though Diane is the only one who speaks English) and are always willing to please. They also have a pot of delicious Coba coffee brewing at all times in the reception area. The hotel grounds are well-kept and they even have a swimming pool, barbecue grills, a hammock, and a little cozy area by the pool that's perfect if you want to just chill and relax. After all, you are on vacation. :) Our room is more than adequate enough for 2 adults and has a small kitchenette; it really helped us save some money by cooking our own meal at times. A clothesline is also provided (with clothespin) by your private patio area. The only complaint I have is that El Acuario, unlike most other hotels, DO NOT provide shampoo...they only provide a small bar of soap. Additionally, you won't find hair dryer in your room either, you have to borrow it from the reception (you're lucky if Diane is there because Fabiola did not understand what I wanted). The hotel is strategically located to important places like the beach (5 short blocks), 5th Avenue (4 short blocks), WalMart (4 short blocks) and colectivos (around the corner). There's also plenty of hole-in-the-wall type restaurants and mini markets nearby. Overall, this hotel served its purpose and I will definitely go back next time we're in Playa del Carmen again.

Reviews.Title: “We love it! If you are looking for a great little authentic Mexican hotel, this is it.”
Reviews.Author: LindaLu2010
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love his hotel. Normally we would stay in a large, all inclusive resort, however since we decided to stay long term, we wanted something a little more authentic, with a Mexican feel. My husband and I did a lot of research before actually booking the hotel. Because we were planning on staying long term, we decided to book a hotel for the first month, and then find a furnished apartment or condo for rent. I saw this hotel on a Playa del Carmen forum, otherwise I would have missed out. Before we even arrived we recieved excellent customer service. Diane answered every email I wrote (and trust me, there were many), in a timely and efficient manner. Having worked in the hospitality industry as a travel agent and at several hotels, I appreciated the quick response, and the fact that she answered every one of my questions honestly. We changed our plans a few times, and it was no problem. Also the reviews on here helped me make my decision as well, because I was a little nervous booking a hotel sight unseen, or one that nobody I knew had been to. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. The suite was just perfect for the 2 of us, it has a living room, dining room, kitchen, large master with king size bed, attached large bathroom with tub and shower, and a half bath as well. All appliances, kitchenware, plates, pans, etc. included. As a matter of fact, it is bigger than most of the condos we have seen in this price range. Nice furniture, a futon if guests stay, and a nice large balcony with hammock (that I can't get my husband out of!!). Because the suite is so nice, and we really love the layout of the hotel, the grounds and the pool, we decided just to stay here instead of renting somewhere else. I can't stress how CLEAN this property is kept. Housekeeping and the front desk attendants are always sweeping and mopping the common areas, they make sure the lobby is kept very clean, they take care of the plants and landscaping, and keep it very nice. I am up early, and I always hear Maria sweeping at about 6am and getting everything ready for the day. We know everyone here, and they know us, even though we speak poquito Spanish and they speak poquito English. Every single person that works here is super friendly, and they will do all they can to help you out. If they don't understand you, they will find someone who will. We also love the layout. It is set up like a mini fortress (but in a good way). There is concrete around the whole property, which I like, and there is one way in/out, so it is very secure. Nobody can come in or out without the front desk or Diane knowing, and someone is always here. The pool is very nice, not huge but it doesn't have to be because there are only 12 rooms plus the suite. It really feels more like a nice apartment complex to me. Usually I am the only one in the pool, I like to lounge on my raft and get a tan while taking a siesta!! If I am not the only one out there, usually it is 1 or 2 people besides me. I had Diane show me a regular room as well. They are a nice size, I believe they all have a mini fridge, and some have hot plates. Nice, clean rooms. The location of this property is great. 5 very short blocks to the beach, 4 to 5th Ave., 4 to Walmart, 5 to Mega (which is a great store by the way), with Aki in between (like Sam's), 2 to Benito Juarez (my favorite shoe shopping street) and lot's of local restaurants in between. Also the beach here is nice, not rocky, and it's about 5 blocks to the ferry to Cozumel ($60usd round trip). There is a mini super and nice authentic little restaurant across the street (yummy food). I can't tell you how many local restaurants we would have missed out on had we stayed in an all inclusive, and most of the restaurants are inexpensive and have great food. If you want fancier places, there are a ton on 5th Ave. We have been here for 3 months, and because this feels like an apartment complex, we do feel like we are home. We get to meet lot's of people who stay at the property, which is nice. There is also a hotel cat named Coco who visits us. That helps me out because I had to leave my dog at home! Very comfortable clean hotel. If you are looking for a 5 star with dining, room service and an expensive nightly rate, this isn't the property for you. If you are looking for a nice, authentic Mexican property, that is clean and has friendly staff, then you will like it here. I can say our mattress is a little hard, but after being here for 3 months we have gotten used to it. As a matter of fact, my husband who has back problems has had better luck with this firm mattress than he did with our sleep number bed at home. There are little sugar ants here, but this is Mexico and I see them everywhere, even in the jewelry store. If you ask they will spray at your request, and since we have been here they have sprayed on a regular basis anyway. We have not seen any roaches in the room, as one other person said they did. There is not a restaurant here, but there are plenty within walking distance. And there is a grill outside, which we have used several times. We really do love it here, and hopefully will get to stay for a whole year. So far we have not had any problems, as a matter of fact it is better than living at home, because housekeeping cleans our room and does our laundry for us (we give her a nice tip!!).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price cute and comfy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carstens123
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my fiancee and a friend at el acuario hotel in september. The rooms are comfortable and very affordable,ours had a nice kitchenette and fridge, the hotel also has a nice pool, extremely helpful service from all staff. -to make it more homey there is a grill in the garden area to do evening barbecues! Fantastic! It is very close by to the main street and beach. We like this place so much that we are returning again!

Reviews.Title: “It is a place like home!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katherineviernes
Reviews.Content: Its a beauiful warm place, the people and service are great, you feel like @ home but way better!!!!! You make friends while your there and they make you want to stay and not go home!

Reviews.Title: “SIMPLY THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: diveproCancunDiving
Reviews.Content: I live in Cancun and often I take groups diving to Playa del Carmen and Cozumel. We used to go to other hotels, but since several of our divers and friends from Cancun and abroad, told us about this place, We decided to try it. Our group really enjoyed everything. The rooms very clean and nice, WIFI was a real break, It is walking distance to the beach, the town and the big super markets. ALL the staff are very nice I had trouble with my car and Gerson helped me pushing it and indicated me the closest mechanic (a block away) Fabiola was really nice to everyone and made our stay fantastic. Diane the manager is really on top of everything always, the pool is at perfect temperature, they have coffee all day at reception it is very tasty. In all a great experience and we wil for sure be back, I left a shirt that is more of sentimental value and Diane and also the staff called noted this, they will keep it for me, so now I am forced to come back NEXT WEEKEND. Thank you Diane and staff

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time at the El Acuario Htl”
Reviews.Author: Laurahernandez_11
Reviews.Content: The whole month my family and I stayed at the El Acuario Htl. Wonderful place, confortable and clean.So near from the beach so you can walk everyday and enjoy the wonderful sea of Playa del Carmen. You have the personal care of the adminitrator, Diane. She makes you feel like in your own home.She gives you the advice or all the tips that you need to enjoy the tours, the best food or shopping.. Wonderful weather in a wonderfull place. We loved it and we"ll be back! Laura Hernàndez Mexico,City

Reviews.Title: “The best Hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: mayamayab
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Acuario is the best of the best Hotel in Playa del Carmen because everybody there is kind and make you feel as in home....also very clean and with a lot of segurity, the location its perfect and for this reason is a quite and relax place,...I love it!....Is like to be in home!! Thanks to all Miss Diane........you and your people there are the best!!! We will see us very soon!!! GREAT HOTEL! ...great service....and great people!!! Thanks again...Best Regards Ana Maria ....

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: CarlaElias
Reviews.Content: Terrible beds, I was reading some other comments and is a nice, clean small hotel, very friendly staff, however the beds, I did stay for a month and my back, neck was killing me every morning, very hard to sleep, you can feel the springs coming up from the bed when your in bed or just touching with your hand. Internet another problem, the WIFI, sucks, hard if you bring your laptop with you. Thats the only thing that I felt was not right for the price, pay $600.00 pesos for a hard bed it is not a great deal, otherwise if I see the rest is the only thing that helps the hotel, the manager, sometimes I felt that was to friendly at the times, to much drinking with clients, that I felt was right; but the rest of the staff was nice and friendly always with respect.

Reviews.Title: “A well kept secret for a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Maggie499288
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay @ the El Acuario. My husband & I don't care for large resorts, preferring smaller places that are more quaint. Although it doesn't have ALL of the big hotel amenities, it has most everything you would need (i.e A/C, cable TV, microwave, small fridge, hot plate if requested & a "service kit" with plates, cutlery etc. The hotel & grounds are kept very clean. There is a small pool, an outdoor grill, palapa area. It is close to downtown & the beaches (about 4-5 walking blocks). It is also within' walking distance of a "Super Walmart". All of the rooms have showers (with hot water). There is also one 2 bd.room apt. that is part of the hotel. We have stayed for 2 weeks @ a fraction of the cost of what a resort or "all inclusive" is. If we didn't have to board our dog, we would have stayed for a month or longer. They have both short & longer term rental prices. I would definitly return! In addition, the manager, Diane, is excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Other guest told me not to review El Acuario hotel because they don't want anyone else to know about it!”
Reviews.Author: SUZ73157
Reviews.Content: The administrator, Diane, really makes this hotel great! She makes you feel so welcomed and is ready to assist you to make your stay the best. She is very detail oriented and keeps the beautiful courtyard, and rooms well maintained. The pool and BBQ are a big bonus. Everything you need is very close, within walking distance. The rooms are very clean. Refrig, microwave, and hot plates, and utensils are available. We really enjoyed our patio, each room has an outside area. Had a great stay there and will definately go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly atmosphere and beautiful setting make this oasis a must for travelers seeking a place like home.”
Reviews.Author: 1cparker
Reviews.Content: The administrator speaks French, Spanish and English making communication easy. Hot coffee is available in the office in the morning and all staff greet you warmly whenever you see them. You will feel very secure as someone is awake in the office 24/7. The hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood with grocery and fruit neighborhood stores around the corner. The rooms all have tv, a small frig and free wi-fi, a ceiling fan and air conditioning. You can unpack your things and feel at home using the closet and dresser provided. Each room has it's own patio and a couple chairs in addtion to the common area around the pool and grill area. There is a covered circular palapa with pillows so you can sit and visit with others. The pool is always clean an a refreshing alternative to the beach. **There is a resident turtle (tortuga) named Houdini and a kitten (gatito) named Elacuario that add to the hominess of the hotel. The acommodations fit singles traveling alone or together as well as couples of all ages. The beach is a short five block walk in one direction with a Walmart and Mega grocery store a four block walk in another. Neighborhood restaurants are around every corner in this easy to navigate city.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem less than 10 minutee from beach”
Reviews.Author: marktEnfield
Reviews.Content: I first discovered this family run hotel when a tourist I befriended showed me his room last January. The first thing I noticed was the bright and breezy rooms tastefully decorated with nice private balconies attached. The garden is tasteful and has some character, and the pool area is a pleasant size with newish sunbeds. The rooms have a decent size fridge and cooking facilities including a microwave. The beds are large and comfortable and the showers are powerful too. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Honeyleeb
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very nice for the price,nice pool,clean rooms,great service,good coffee in the entrancevery quiet while we were there.Friendly staffcute little garden,outdoor bar-b-q,very relaxing.Close to all shops on 5th ave,10 minute walk to beach and 5th ave.My 2 teenagers like it very much as well,especialy the t.v. and the hammock................lol.I would love to go there again,my brother goes there every year,always to this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: El Acuario Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Av. 25 Norte entre 2 y 4 Norte Col. Centro, Playa del Carmen, Mexico
